rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Lectures well-organized but fairly dry. Instructor very nice; always willing to meet students halfway. Good at leading interesting class discussions.

Lectures were fairly boring, though straight-forward.  If you read the book, going to class was probably not necessary-though I did.  Not a great experience, but not a bad one either for an introductory (and huge) class.

I had her for a first year seminar. She is a really nice lady; very set in her ways. I heard that she is a much better professor with the grad students one-on-one. Bland, course material not fun. She doesn't seem fit to teach a classroom full- only indiv.
